channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Volkswagen, Germany’s largest private employer, could cut over 15,000 jobs with plant closures—and there’s no plan B, Jefferies says
item.description: Jefferies analyst said that Volkswagen's unions "can only strike on pay, not plant closure or layoffs if the latter are not contractually protected.”

item.title: Defense ‘Prioritization’ Is Not Enough
item.description: Prioritizing among the many threats our nation faces is important. But we must also rebuild our declining military.

item.title: China controls 70% of the world’s critical rare earth minerals. Finding an alternative is proving tough—and expensive
item.description: The U.S. and its allies are trying to find new sources of rare earth metals, used in phones and fighter jets, outside of China.

item.title: Republicans Should Go from Trump’s ‘Concepts’ to Plan on Health Care
item.description: When Republicans don’t advance their own health-care policies, big-government progressives are happy to fill the void.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE: Pennsylvania Motor Voter System Will Be Audited For Noncitizen Voters
item.description: In Pennsylvania, at least 628,234 noncitizens had a state-issued ID, according to a Right-to-Know request. Were any registered to vote?

item.title: Distress Investing: Crime Scene Investigation
item.description: In the underbelly of private markets lies the main culprit behind corporate failures: defective capital structuring.

item.title: Biden talks with Trump after second assassination attempt

item.title: What Are the Rules?

item.title: Debate Flashback: Trump Said Democrat Rhetoric Led Directly To Assassination Attempts Against Him
item.description: 'I probably took a bullet to the head because of the things that they say about me.'
